byline.original: By ERIC LICHTBLAU and STEVEN LEE MYERS

abstract: Cheryl D Mills, former chief of staff for Hillary Clinton during her tenure at State Dept, says in deposition that decision to use private email server was ill-considered but not attempt to evade Freedom of Information Act; Mills's comments are first sworn public accounting from member of Clinton's staff as controversy over use of private email server is reignited following release of highly critical report from inspector general's office at State Dept.
lead_paragraph: Testimony by Cheryl D. Mills, chief of staff when Hillary Clinton was secretary of state, represented the first sworn public accounting from a member of Mrs. Clinton’s inner circle.

headline.main: Hillary Clinton Aide Says Little Thought Was Given to Potential Issues Over Private Email
headline.print_headline: Clinton Aide Says Little Thought Was Given to Potential Issues Over Private Email

snippet: Testimony by Cheryl D. Mills, chief of staff when Hillary Clinton was secretary of state, represented the first sworn public accounting from a member of Mrs. Clinton’s inner circle.
